DataElement.preferredName: Patient Neoplasm Personal Medical History Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the indicator related to a person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment with history of an abnormal tissue growth resulted from uncontrolled cell proliferation.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment with history of an abnormal tissue growth resulted from uncontrolled cell proliferation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: (NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Patient Neoplasm Personal Medical History Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: an event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied for patient's medical history of tumor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated to add NCIt concept relationship. Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: Earlier in time or order.: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ReferenceDocuments.name: If the patient has had a prio
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has had a prior invasive malignancy (except non-melanoma skin cancer), has she had any evidence of disease within the last 5 years or does the prior malignancy treatment contraindicate the current protocol therapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had another invasive malignancy (other than non-melanoma of the skin, localized cancer of the breast, head and neck or skin) diagnosed, present or recur within the past 5 years

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had another invasive malignancy other than non-melanoma skin cancer present or recur within the past 3 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had another invasive malignancy other than non-melanoma of the skin, localized cancer of the breast, head and neck or skin diagnosed, present or recur within the past 3 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient been diagnosed with an invasive malignancy other than non-melanoma skin cancer less than 5 years from today

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of invasive cancer other than non-melanoma skin cancer that has been active within the last 5 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had another invasive malignancy other than non-melanoma of the skin, carcinoma in situ of the cervix, or ductal carcinoma in situ of the breast present or recur within the past 3 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had another invasive malignancy other than non-melanoma of the skin present or recur within the past 5 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a history of other invasive malignancies being present within the last three years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRf Text11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of the presence of other invasive malignancies, other than non-melanoma skin cancer, within the past 5 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of another invasive malignancy other than non-melanoma of the skin, localized cancer of the breast, head and neck or skin diagnosed, present or recur within the past 3 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had another invasive malignancy with the exception of non-melanoma skin cancer, localized cancer of the breast, head and neck or skin diagnosed, present or recur within the past 3 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient alive and has experienced relapse of original cancer and/or developed subsequent cancer (other than non-melanomatous skin cancer) since their original diagnosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of other invasive malignancies, with the exception of non-melanoma skin cancer, being present within the last three years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of other invasive malignancies, with the exception of non-melanoma skin cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of other invasive malignancies, with the exception of non-melanoma skin cancer less than or equal to five years ago?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had prior invasive malignancy (other than non-melanomatous skin cancer), within the last 3 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had prior invasive malignancy (other than non-melanomatous skin cancer), within the last 3 years?  (carcinoma in situ of the breast, oral cavity, or cervix  are permissible)

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Free of any co-existing or prior invasive malignancy(except non- melanomatous skin cancer) for a minimum of 3 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a prior invasive malignancy diagnosed within the last three years (except [1] non-melanoma skin cancer or [2] prior in situ carcinoma of the cervix)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has had a prior invasive malignancy (except non-melanoma skin cancer or other malignancies as noted in Section 3.34) does the prior malignancy treatment contraindicate the current protocol therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had any other invasive malignancy within the past 5 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG)CRF Text 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an uncontrolled prior invasive malignancy, excluding the current diagnosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had any other invasive cancer within the past 5 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: URCC21038
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have a current diagnosis of invasive cancer at stage I-IV (Patients may have a history of previous cancer diagnosis and cancer treatment not involving immunotherapy)

ReferenceDocuments.name: URCC22053
ReferenceDocuments.description: Be diagnosed with Stage I-IV prostate cancer without metastases to bone (lymph node involvement and prior diagnosis of a primary cancer is allowed).
